text:
Tachycardia, Other
   Assessment:
   -          Sinus tach to 130s, particularly when agitated.
   -          Maintained BP during tachycardic episodes
   Action:
   -          5 IVP lopressor administered
   -          Standing dose lopressor administered
   -          Attempted to calm patient down
 administered haldol 1 mg
   X1; increased fent gtt when patient c/o pain
   Response:
   -          5 IV lopressor didn
t touch tachycardia
   -          PO lopressor standing dose appears to be keeping patient
   rate in 80s-90s
   -          Haldol worked with fair success
 patient appears more calm;
   fentanyl gtt back to 100 after patient calm and sleeping X several
   hours
   Plan:
   -          Continue beta blocker
   -          Continue to treat patient
s anxiety and pain
   Subdural hemorrhage (SDH)
   Assessment:
   -          Patient arousable on fent gtt
   -          Intermittently following commands
   -          MAEs
 strong in upper extremities; lift/fall back or
   withdrawal to pain in other extremities
   Action:
          - Neuro checks Q2
   Response:
          - Remains arousable, agitated at times; mouthing words
   occasionally
   Plan:
   -          Continue neuro checks Q2
   Fever, unknown origin (FUO, Hyperthermia, Pyrexia)
   Assessment:
   - Spiked to 101.8
   Action:
   -          Urine cultured and blood cultured
   -          Tylenol 650 mg admin
   -          Aztreonam and Vanc administered
   Response:
   - Continues to be febrile but improving
   Plan:
   -          Monitor temp, WBC, other s/s infection
   -          Continue abx therapy
   -          Follow up cultures
   Respiratory failure, chronic
   Assessment:
   -          Patient on [**11-24**] in start of shift
   -          Suctioning moderate amount of thin tan/yellow secretions
   -          De-satted to 92%
   Action:
   -          Resp increased PEEP to 10 from 8
   -          Suctioned patient
   Response:
   - Sats improved to 97-98%
   Plan:
   -          Continue to monitor, wean vent if tolerated.
